chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery R. Thome

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gregory Bates in court for Jeffery R. Thome. Defendant Jeffery R. Thome in court. Clerk. M.Burke. State in victim rights compliance. State agrees with Dr. report.  Attorney Bates advises that the DE states he is competent. State does not stipulate to that and agrees with the doctors findings.
Evidentiary hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Clerk MB tried to arrange a zoom appearance with Winnebago and was told via email from Dean Silfies that the DE discharge on 09/22/22.

NO RECORD MADE. Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State. Attorney Gregory Bates in court for Jeffery R. Thome. Clerk. M.Burke. Clerk was not made aware that the DE was transferred to Winnebago. Hearing set over to set up zoom appearance.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
for Comp Exam - AMENDED - Last name spelled incorrectally on prior one.
Complaint and Order for Comp Exam sent to DHS and WISCS.

No time  
  Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody but no appearance.  Atty Greg Bates.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Referred to Br 2 for comp hrg on 10/12/22 @ 10:30am.  DE appearance waived.  Atty raises issue of competency.  Court orders comp exam.   jk

State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant Jeffery R. Thome not in court.  Clerk: PU
  Minutes:  DE is currently in custody and was transported to Winnebago regarding ME so time limits are tolled for cause today and hearing set over for a status conference.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Michael T., Rose T.

227PM    Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Zachary Caley.  Victim: M.T.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on August 11, 2022 at 09:45 am.  $2000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  ts
